intro: Sahagunia colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian sahagunia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Sahagunia colombiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance in its native ecosystem.
